title: It's mostly good, but has a significantly annoying error which lets it down
comment: It works, until I change a setting in the phone's OS interface manually, then it stops working until I restart the app.  So for example, let's say I have it set to go silent at 10pm and for the sound to turn back on at 8am. Well, sometimes there will be an exceptional exception (i.e. not one I can program into Timeriffic), and I will just want to turn it silent for a little bit (using the OS interface) or vice versa, expecting Timeriffic to continue setting the settings as instructed at the scheduled times -- e.g. I might silence it at 9am, and then unsilence it at 10am, expecting it to silence again at 10pm -- but instead it just stops doing it at all, even though the app says it's still enabled.  If this error can be fixed, I will donate to the Timeriffic developer/s, but only if they will accept Bitcoin. I don't like registering all my details with third party payment providers, connecting them to my bank account, and giving them a cut of every transaction.

title: WARNING:  Reads personal log
comment: Post a negative review for any app that unnecessarily accesses personal information.  It's important to raise awareness of the privacy issues.  If enough people complain then the developers may fix the app.

For privacy reasons we don't grab logs from the system or other apps -- just our own. Used by the app to allow users to report feedback/errors. In app use Menu > Send Feedback, it pulls the log for Timeriffic and generates an email that the user can review before sending. We filter the log to only retrieve logs from Timeriffic. ? tweet @rdrrlabs

title: Control gps?
comment: Dear Devs,  is there any chance you could allow the ability to control gps? Someone replied to this earlier with the answer "uninstall the app if it's using GPS" however that's not good. For example, facebook will use GPS but I don't want it to all the time, so turn off GPS but I turn it on for Google maps etc. Hope that helps

GPS is a system-protected setting. You can only change it via the Home, Settings app. You can also try to use the Power widget which is integrated in Android.

You don't need to toggle this as the setting doesn't toggle GPS hardware, merely it allows other apps to use it. If an app is using GPS when it should not. Remove it.  ?? tweet us @rdrrlabs

title: Great App for scheduling volume, wi-fi, bluetooth settings
comment: 03AUG2013.  I have been using Timeriffic almost a year now.  It is great because you can set schedules to adjust volume, wi-fi, blue tooth, etc.  Great for setting it to turn on Blue Tooth about 10 minutes before you normally leave for work, then turn off wi-fi 10 minutes after you normally leave (of course setting a reverse sequence for coming home), setting volumes for routine weekly meetings at work (controls Alarm volume, some APPS do to, then your alarm might go off during a meeting).  I even set one for 0100HRS (yes i am in the Army) to turn all volumes to 100% in case I forgot to do that before going to bed, thus my alarm volume will be at 100% when the alarm needs to go off at 0500HRS.----Can use QUICK PROFILES PRO to easily select volume profiles you craeated and over ride TIMERIFFIC for those unscheduled meetings----use SHUSH and it will ask you how long to keep the volume suppressed, again for unscheduled meetings/activities.  Great APP.  One of my favorites.

title: Neat little app
comment: Does a pretty good job. Easy enough to use. Simple and unobtrusive.  This is a very useful app to have if you find yourself in a situation where there are regular times that your phone *must* ring, as loud as possible; and there are other times when you need to make sure that your phone stays dead silent. Remembering to do this manually multiple times a each day is a chore, and being able to set things up once to do it for you automatically is wonderful.  The only real feature it is missing (for me anyway) is the ability to set a once-off timed exception (eg. override all settings and be silent for four hours, and then go back to normal). I hope something like this makes it into a future version.

comment: This seems to be exactly what I need, in that it lets me control media, alarm and system volume rather than only the ringer.  Some suggestions: Firstly, the times that I want to silence the phone vary slightly from day to day with my work hours. It would be handy if you could set up a profile for one day then copy it multiple times and just change the start/finish times.  Secondly, it would be handy if there was one button that just basically said "Silence Everything!" instead of having to silence the ringer, vibrate, media, alarm and system volumes separately. I'm not saying you'd want to use it every time but when you do it would be quite handy.

So, the way things are now with this app, it is somewhat unusable. If I do like it says and simply adjust the "ring volume" than all my notifications are still too loud/quiet. Hopefully you guys can fix this, cause it's an otherwise excellent app, but since my primary use is to reduce notification volume at night, at current it is quite useless...

title: Moving On
comment: Decent app, but it didn't work well for me.  I liked being able to adjust my sound settings on a schedule, but Timeriffic gives you no easy option for deviating from that schedule (ie - moving to a different sound profile earlier than you normally would).  Also, personally, it is easier for me to conceptualize my sound profiles as having a range (ie "night" is from 11pm-7am) than just a start time (ie "night" starts at 11pm and never ends, but "day" overrides it at 7am).  I just made the switch to AudioGuru and am already liking it a lot better.  It doesn't allow me to change settings like bluetooth and WiFi, but I honestly never used those features in Timeriffic anyway.

title: Great app, awesome service from developer
comment: This is an awesome app. I like it because I can set it to turn the ringer/tones on and off at certain times, as well as wifi/data, that sort of stuff; I don't have to worry about forgetting to turn my ringer back on in the morning. You can set it so that you have several schedules during the day and even change it for the weekend. I did have a problem with the time reverting back when I use 24 hour time, and also with the ringer not turning back on in the morning, but I contacted the developer from directly in the app (you don't have to search all over the place to find it) and he got back to me in less than 12 hours. He let me know the results of his testing, and gave me a work around until an update can be put out (I have a rooted HTC Sensation running ICS). I have to say I was really impressed by that because I had tried to contact a developer regarding another app, and after repeated attempts, I only got a response when I changed my rating to one star, and then he said that it would have been an easy fix, but because I had left a bad review, he would not help me. So...awesome app, awesome developer, would totally recommend this app to any and everyone.

title: "Notification uses ring volume" has a bug.
comment: Timeriffic 1.09.12 still has a bug in the "Notification uses ring volume" . If you have an action that sets the ring volume to something and sets the notification volume to "Notification uses ring volume", the notification volume doesn't get updated to match the new ring volume. Version 1.09.07 doesn't have the bug. Otherwise, this is a great app: fine-grained control that many other apps don't expose (like setting vibration differently for notification and calls); low memory usage; reliable operation.
It's missing GPS & sync, and it may fail if you disable, enable later, but do not "check now."
